description.narrative: # studies for evidence-based L&A disseminated to political actors

comment.narrative: NIMD has not worked previously with women led CSOs at territorial levels. NIMD’s interest for this first year is to build trust with these actors and consolidate a network of support and work with the purpose of retrieve experiences of their impact on the definition of key elements of the territorial peacebuilding and gender-equity agenda.

NIMD Colombia, in the framework of the global actions of the L4P Consortium, elaborated a paper "Political participation of women in Colombia: advocacy actions from NIMD Colombia's programmes". The purpose of the paper was to make visible the contribution of women to the consolidation of the peace agenda, as well as the current challenges and risks they face in their communities.
This document was accompanied by a video with interviews with different social and political leaders

NIMD Colombia expects to develop and disseminate at least one study for evidence-based L&A per year, for a total of five (5) studies for evidence-based L&A by the end of the project. It is important to note that during 2021, NIMD has advance in one L&A study, but it will only be published until 2022.

title.narrative: # of women-led CSOs included in the programme activities

description.narrative: # of women-led CSOs included in the programme activities

comment.narrative:
NIMD has not worked previously with women led CSOs at territorial levels. NIMD’s interest for this first year is to build trust with these actors and consolidate a network of support and work that intends to develop L&A initiatives for territorial implementation of peace projects.
As far as July 31 NIMD conducted a preliminary survey with partner CSOs of national coverage to measure their capacities to mobilize and position women and peace agendas in decision-making scenarios. This survey allows us to develop interventions more tailored to their needs and the expectations of NIMD. 9 actors from national CSOs were surveyed.
This I.O. and indicator was not measured since the target is set to start in 2022

By the end of the year NIMD expects to map territorial and local networks of CSOs and feminist organizations interested in the development of L&A capabilities. NIMD expects to work with at least 2 CSOs at all territorial levels where the program develops interventions.
By the end of the program NIMD expects to include at least 10 women led CSOs in the program activities.

title.narrative: # women-led CSOs with increased L&A capacities

description.narrative: # women-led CSOs with increased L&A capacities

comment.narrative:
NIMD has not worked previously with women led CSOs at territorial levels. NIMD’s interest for this first year is to build trust with these actors and consolidate a network of support and work that intends to develop L&A initiatives for territorial implementation of peace projects.
As far as July 31 NIMD conducted a preliminary survey with partner CSOs of national coverage to measure their capacities to mobilize and position women and peace agendas in decision-making scenarios. This survey allows us to develop interventions more tailored to their needs and the expectations of NIMD.
Among the main results, we find that only 44% of the CSOs work with topics related to gender equality and only 22% with political participation.
On the other hand, even though 100% of them promote spaces for dialogue and 88.8% consider that their advocacy strategies are effective, only 55% claim to have the capacity to mobilize relevant actors in matters of gender equity and peace.
Only 44% of the CSOs surveyed state that they prioritize participation at institutional spaces, which is related to the same percentage claiming to be recognized by institutional actors.
This I.O. and indicator was not measured since the target is set to start in 2022

By the end of the year NIMD expects to map territorial and local networks of CSOs and feminist organizations interested in the development of L&A capabilities.
By the end of the program NIMD expects to increase the capabilities of 8 women led CSOs in the program activities. Considering the survey previously mentioned NIMD will promote CSO’s capacities for them to be able to reach relevant actors to mobilize the agenda of equity and peace. NIMD will also promote L&A strategies so CSOs increment their participation at institutional spaces and get recognition by institutional actors with the purpose to strengthen their collaboration on a joint agenda for women and peace.

comment.narrative: 39 political actors to July 31st, 2021 17 from political parties, 20 from local elected bodies, the Ministry of the Interior and National Electoral Council.

In the 9 dialogue spaces developed by NIMD, the following participated:
Type of actor: 15 political parties, national leadership 18 political parties, local leadership 14 sub-national collegiate bodies

description.narrative: # multi-stakeholder dialogue/platform meetings
# multi-stakeholder dialogue/platform meetings

comment.narrative: NIMD has not worked previously with women leading CSOs at territorial levels. NIMD’s interest for this first year is to build trust with these actors and consolidate a network of support and work with the purpose to reach consensus on the gender equity agenda.
This corresponds to the I.O. 4.2. Women CSOs/Feminist movements develop joint gender-equality agenda and indicator was not measured since the target is set to start in 2022

By the end of the year NIMD aims to map territorial and local networks of CSOs and feminist organizations interested in the consolidation of a joint agenda on gender equity.
NIMD Colombia will develop at least two (2) multi-stakeholder dialogue/platform meetings per year (starting in 2022), for a total of eight (8) multi-stakeholder dialogue/platform meetings by the end of the project

By the end of the year NIMD aims to map territorial and local networks of CSOs and feminist organizations interested in the consolidation of a joint agenda on gender equity.

title.narrative: # interparty dialogue meetings
# interparty dialogue meetings

description.narrative: # interparty dialogue meetings
# interparty dialogue meetings

comment.narrative: NIMD is recognized by gender officials of political actors as an impartial actor and leader of safe spaces to promote dialogue on gender equality. This year, NIMD has led, along with local partners, 3 interparty dialogue meetings on the topics: District Multiparty Dialogue for women, National Multiparty Dialogue for women and Multiparty Dialogue of women local councilors.

During 2021, NIMD Colombia, in partnership with the Ministry of the Interior and the District Secretariat for Women, carried out 9 spaces for multi-party dialogue, broken down as follows:
- 1 Multiparty Women's Roundtable at the national level. - 3 multi-party women's roundtables at the regional level (1 in the city of Medellín, Antioquia, and 2 in the city of Popayán, Cauca). - 3: Multi-party women's roundtables at district level in Bogotá. - 2 district meetings of women councillors in the city of Bogotá

NIMD will take advantage of the recognition and trust gained with political actors to develop 2 more interparty dialogue meetings on the second half of 2021 on the following topics: violence against women in politics, PAU principles (parity, alternance, universality), among others. Furthermore, will start the inception phase for rolling out innovative dialogue approaches based on the principles of the deliberative democracy and design thinking.

comment.narrative:
2 institutional political actors adopted internal measures to ensure gender equality.
1. The Partido de la U requested technical assistance from NIMD Colombia to update its statutes. NIMD made recommendations to incorporate measures in favour of the political participation of women and the LGBTI population.
2. Alianza Verde Party, requested technical assistance from NIMD Colombia for the revision of its protocol on gender-based violence and violence against women in politics. NIMD Colombia made suggestions to strengthen the action route and immediate reparation measures for women victims.

comment.narrative: NIMD has not worked previously with women led CSOs at territorial levels. NIMD’s interest for this first year is to build trust with these actors and consolidate a network of support and work that intends to mobilize L&A initiatives for territorial implementation of peace projects.
This I.O. and indicator was not measured since the target is set for 2025

By the end of the year NIMD aims to map territorial and local networks of CSOs and feminist organizations interested in the consolidation of L&A initiatives for the peace-building agenda. By the end of the project, NIMD Colombia will promote at least two high impact national advocacy initiatives.

title.narrative: Share of women candidates

Share of women candidates

comment.narrative: 71 women manifest their interest to participate as candidates in election scenarios, 26 at municipal councils, 15 at Local Councils (JAL) and 8 at Youth Municipal Councils, 4 at Mayorships, and 7 Departmental Assemblies, 5 at National Congress

This corresponds to the I.O. 1.2. and the correct indicator is # Of women who partake in NIMD trainings that are willing to candidate themselves for decision-making positions.
During 2021, 50 women participants in the different training processes developed by NIMD expressed their interest in running for elected office: - 13 to the Senate of the Republic - 7 for the House of Representatives - 2 for Mayor's Office - 3 for Departmental Assemblies - 14 for Municipal Councils - 7 to Municipal Youth Councils - 4 to Local Action Boards

title.narrative: # women (aspiring) leaders trained
# women (aspiring) leaders trained

description.narrative: # women (aspiring) leaders trained
# women (aspiring) leaders trained

comment.narrative: Up to July 31st, 134 aspiring female leaders have been trained by NIMD since L4P Programme started

893 political and civic women participated in the following NIMD training processes: 1. 8 Democracy Schools, under its "School of Dialogue Innovation and Leadership" model in the departments of La Guajira, Cesar, Cordoba, Cauca, Cauca, Tolima, Caqueta and Valle del Cauca. A total of 257 women participated in these processes, 82 of whom were young women.
2. Empowerment Schools: Aimed exclusively at emerging civic and political leaders. Three schools were implemented in alliance with three territorial entities (Government of Valle del Cauca, Government of Bolivar and Mayor's Office of Cota) in which 98 women participated, of which 32 were young women.
3. Schools and training for political parties: (Partido Social de Unidad Nacional - Partido de la U, Partido Cambio Radical and Partido Polo Democrático Alternativo) carried out 3 training initiatives for their militants and potential candidates, through which 113 women were trained, of which 24 were young women.
4. Training for other relevant actors: NIMD Colombia in alliance with Ministry of Interior, Occupy Politics and ARN trained 425 women, of which 222 were young women.
Of these 839 women trained 102 said they were:
- Afro-descendants: 52 - LGBTQ+: 6 - Indigenous: 16 - Displaced: 2 - Disabled: 2 - Victims: 24
The election of Municipal Youth Councils allowed us to far surpass the target set for 2021.
